content:
Hi everyone! I'm not sure if this is the right place to bring this up, but while reviewing the Dataverse documentation (https://guides.dataverse.org/en/6.4/user/), I noticed that some links are broken. The links under "Supported Metadata" in the Appendix section seem to be non-functional: https://guides.dataverse.org/en/6.4/user/appendix.html. For example, this link leads to a missing file: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/u/0/d/13HP-jI_cwLDHBetn9UKTREPJ_F4iHdAvhjmlvmYdSSw/edit#gid=0 (Citation Metadata).

It looks like the files referenced in this section may have been deleted. Could someone from this group help resolve this issue? Thanks in advance!

Hi @Aina JenÃ© , I had a quick look and the link has been deleted in the latest version: https://guides.dataverse.org/en/latest/user/appendix.html. You can also view the entire model in the tsv in GitHub as linked on the page, the google sheet was the same thing, just in a google sheet. So, if you download the tsv and import in excel or google sheets, it should result in the same thing.
2 messages were moved here from #docs > doc group meeting by Philip Durbin ðŸš€.
Hi! Please see this pull request! Removing broken links behind metadata block names on Appendix page #11055
Which fixed this issue: In User Guide Appendix, most links to Google Sheets that show metadata block TSVs are broken #11028
thank you for the speedy reply! I see there's already ongoing work to remove the broken links, which is perfect!! :)
